articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Central Zoo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Central Zoo
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave on-the-spot guidance to the Central Zoo. 
					 Kim Jong Un first went round the monument erected to convey the undying leadership exploits of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu down through generations. 
					
					 He recollected with deep emotion the glorious course covered by the zoo, noting that it had the honor of receiving on-the-spot guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il dozens of times and has creditably fulfilled its mission as a place for joyful rest making visitors laugh and pleasing them and a center for education imbuing them with wide knowledge about animals over the last more than five decades since it was established.
					
					 Going round different places of the zoo, he learned in detail about the management and operation of it. 
					
					 He dropped in at the aquarium to learn about its operation. He asked workers there if there is any problem arising in breeding fish, what measures are taken to provide food and water to it and what species of sea fish are raised. 
					
					 He was satisfied to hear officials of the zoo say that thorough measures are taken to provide food and the completion of the Nampho-Pyongyang seawater pipe helped settle the issue of seawater, a difficulty in breeding sea water fishes. 
					
					 He visited the pool for seals and the reptile house. What is important for sprucing up animal houses is to create friendly natural environment to help visitors see animals clearly and learn about their true habitation and provide them with sufficient living conditions, he said. 
					
					 He went to the gift animal house to watch with keen attention rare animals including Indian constrictor, lemur and flying fox which Jonas Whalstram, director of Skansen Aquarium in Sweden, presented to leader Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 He dropped in at a shed of wild animals. He met Kim Sun Ok, head of the wild animal work team who has worked at the zoo for 45 years, and Myong Su Il who has tended bears for nearly 30 years and appreciated their efforts.
					
					 He also moved to a veterinary hospital built on the initiative of Kim Jong Il. Kim Jong Un underlined the need to take efficient veterinary, anti-epizootic and treatment measures for animals.
					
					 He highly praised the officials and other employees of the zoo for having taken good care of animals and devoted their wisdom and efforts to pleasing visitors by successfully organizing their tour. 
					
					 He put forth the tasks to be carried out to manage and operate the zoo.
					
					 It is necessary to spruce up the zoo and steadily improve its operation. 
					
					 The zoo should increase the species of animals and bring more giraffes, zebras and other animals from foreign countries and more rare animals.
					
					 It is necessary to build a main building symbolic of the zoo at its entrance and modernize all animal sheds in line with the characteristic features of animals, while providing convenience to visitors.
					
					 The zoo should have peculiar outdoor and indoor resting places.
					
					 A work should be done to improve the greening of the zoo area as required by the new century.
					
					 It is necessary to take proper measures for supplying water needed for managing the zoo and tending the animals.
					
					 The zoo should set up a new guidepost to meet the need of the zoo.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed expectation and belief that the officials and other employees of the zoo would creditably fulfill their responsibility and mission as a servant of the people.
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yang Gon, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Jae Il, Hwang Pyong So, Pak Chun Hong, Ma Won Chun and Jon Il Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Greets Russia's Ruling Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Greets Russia's Ruling Party Leader
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Dmitri Medvedev on his election as president of the United Russia Party.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you upon your election as president of the United Russia Party at its 13th Congress.
					
					 Your election as president of the party is a manifestation of all your party members' deep trust and expectation for you.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I believe that the issues agreed upon at the DPRK-Russia summits will successfully come true and express conviction that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and countries will further develop in the future.
					
					 I sincerely wish you greater success in your responsible work to consolidate the party and build powerful and modern Russia.
					
					 Please accept my best regard.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Makes Field Survey of Farms and Saltern
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Makes Field Survey of Farms and Saltern
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Saturday visited the Saenal Farm of the Sinchon County and the Oguk Co-op Farm of Anak County in South Hwanghae Province to make field survey of their farming.
					 The farms associated with the leadership exploits of the great persons of Mt. Paektu have made successes in their immediate farming by making full arrangements for finishing the on-going rice-transplantation and other farm work qualitatively in the right time with ardent desire to reap a rich harvest.
					
					 The farms have taken measures for speeding up the rice-transplantation and overcoming the drought despite unfavorable weather as required by the Juche-oriented farming methods. 
					
					 The premier highlighted the importance of settling the food shortage in building a thriving nation and called on all officials and other agricultural workers to play their role as those responsible for the nation's agricultural production.
					
					 He also stressed the need to meet technological requirements for harrowing and winding up the rice-transplanting in right season.
					
					 He underlined the need for all officials to take good care of the farmers' living as their mothers would do by earnestly learning from the dear respected Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on people.
					
					 He called on the relevant units to take steps for supplying farm materials needed for rice-transplantation in good time.
					
					 Then the premier visited the construction site of Hwangnam Youth Saltern in the province nearing its completion.
					
					 The construction of the saltern, covering hundreds of hectares, made it possible to produce a large quantity of salt for the economic development and improvement of people's living standard in the province.
					
					 Looking round the saltern ensuring economic profitability, the premier called for upholding the party with increased output of salt by conducting an effective work for raising the workers' technical skill.

articles.title: Pyongyang Fully Ready to Welcome KCU Delegates
articles.content:
Pyongyang Fully Ready to Welcome KCU Delegates
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang is now busy with preparations to welcome the delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU), which falls on June 6.
					 Good arrangements are being made by cultural and catering establishments in the capital to let KCU delegates spend pleasant and meaningful days.
					
					 The Kaeson Youth Park Funfair is waiting for the arrival of the KCU members after having made full preparations. Catering networks in the funfair have a good stock of foodstuff to serve visitors and its compound is kept neat and tidy.
					
					 Employees of the Central Zoo have made good arrangements for receiving them. A large board welcoming the delegates to the forthcoming great festival has been set up while garlands and flowers are ready to receive them. A deep attention is paid to making a good broadcasting program to welcome them, guiding them to different destinations of the zoo and introducing animals to suit their characteristic feature.
					
					 The zoo is busy making arrangements to let children tour the zoo by flower-decorated chariots and battery-driven cars and watch animals' stunts. 
					
					 The Pyongyang Circus is stepping up preparations for presenting popular numbers, comedic and other acrobatic numbers.
					
					 Cooks and waitresses of Okryu and Chongryu restaurants are ready to serve children with famous Pyongyang cold noodle and delicious dishes. 
					
					 The field of the city passenger transport is doing its best to ensure happy children's comfortable transportation.
					
					 Pyongyang is waiting for the arrival of the above-said delegates who would shoulder upon themselves the future of Songun Korea.

articles.title: US Urged to Take Responsible Approach towards Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
US Urged to Take Responsible Approach towards Nuclear Issue
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- James Cartwright, who was vice-chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff, said shortly ago it is necessary to cut down nukes to get confidence with a view to limiting nuclear programs of such countries as north Korea and Iran, referring to the need for brave reduction of nukes by nuclear powers including the U.S.
					 Minju Joson Sunday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is fortunate that there are in the U.S. some people who think in a relatively proper way about the nuclear issue, though insufficient.
					
					 Most of nukes stockpiled on the globe at present are leftovers of the Cold War and there is no reason whatsoever for them to remain today as the Cold War was over long ago, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The nuclear issue on the peninsula is the product of the U.S. unjust policy of nuclear blackmail. 
					
					 Had the U.S. not pursued the policy of military threat and nuclear blackmail against the DPRK, the DPRK would not have opted to have access to nuclear deterrence requiring huge efforts and funds and the nuclear issue on the peninsula would not have surfaced. 
					
					 There are in south Korea and its vicinity at present nuclear forces of the U.S. threatening the security of the DPRK and the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK persists. It is quite illogical for the DPRK to dismantle its nuclear deterrence unilaterally. 
					
					 The above-said nuclear issue can find its solution only when the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy toward the DPRK before any action to dismantle its nukes in the light of the background against which the issue was spawned and the nature of the structure of the confrontation between the former and the latter.
					
					 If the U.S. truly wants the denuclearization of the peninsula, it should give up its hostile will and policy towards the DPRK and radically defuse its nuclear threat to it. 
					
					 The DPRK will never need even a single nuke when the U.S. renouncement of its hostility towards it is confidently verified and its nuclear threat is completely defused. 
					
					 This tells that the master key to the settlement of the above-said nuclear issue is in the hands of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to behave in a responsible manner, bearing in mind that the prospect for the solution to the nuclear issue hinges on its attitude.

articles.title: Candlelight Rally Protests against Prosecution's Suppression
articles.content:
Candlelight Rally Protests against Prosecution's Suppression
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The Unified Progressive Party, an opposition party of south Korea, held a candlelight rally outside the building of the party in Seoul on Wednesday in protest against the puppet prosecution's suppression.
					 The prosecution did not make a proper probe into the cyber attack conducted by the ruling party during the Seoul mayoral election and its recent illegal inspection of civilians, speakers at the rally recalled, adding that it, however, conducted a forcible search operation against the building of the opposition party.
					
					 All these actions were prompted by the authorities' political plot to quell the people's desire for replacement of the "government" growing stronger ahead of the "presidential" election and wriggle out of the ruling crisis, they noted.
					
					 They accused the authorities of trying to create a fresh political situation under the reign of fascism by attacking all the progressive forces.
					
					 They expressed their willingness to stand up against the authorities' wholesale suppression aimed to disintegrate the progressive political party and undermine the opposition parties' solidarity.

articles.title: S. Koreas' Drop of Hostile Policy Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
S. Koreas' Drop of Hostile Policy Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- 18 civic and public organizations of south Korea including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, Council of Students for Democracy and Independent Reunification, Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, Buddhist Peace Solidarity and Society of April Revolution held a press conference outside Chongwadae on May 23 at which they made public an appeal on the situation urging the authorities to roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK. 
					 The appeal said that the south-north relations, which had headed for national reconciliation, cooperation, peace, reunification and prosperity, have been driven to catastrophe owing to the confrontation policy of the Lee Myung Bak regime. 
					
					 It is the ardent wish of the nation to defuse the danger of war prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and achieve reunification by implementing the south-north joint declarations, it said, and went on:
					
					 It is the only way of weathering the present crisis and achieving peaceful reunification and national prosperity to fully implement the joint declarations. 
					
					 The Lee regime is hell bent on strengthening the alliance for war with the U.S. and Japan, disregarding the issue of national reunification. 
					
					 It is the task of the times for all the progressive forces to punish the Lee dictatorial regime and eliminate Park Geun Hye. 
					
					 Let us struggle to prevent the anti-reunification, undemocratic and unpopular regime from reappearing in this land, bearing in mind truth that unity leads to victory while split leads to ruin. 
					
					 Let us give vent to the anger pent up under five years of the tyrannical of the Lee regime and make 2012 a year of victory at any cost and vigorously usher in an era of peace and reunification.

articles.title: Juche Idea Praised as Great Idea
articles.content:
Juche Idea Praised as Great Idea
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign figures in their congratulatory messages and letters to the dear respected Kim Jong Un expressed conviction that the human cause of independence will be successfully accomplished only when people vigorously struggle guided by the Juche idea, a great guiding idea in the present era.
					 Rosanita Monteiro de Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, said President Kim Il Sung's founding of the Juche idea made it possible for the Korean revolution to break with flunkeyism and dogmatism and advance along a new way based on the principle of national independence.
					
					  Kim Jong Il, a great leader and revolutionary, developed the Juche idea and pursued the Songun politics, he noted.
					
					 Alberto Moreno, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland", said thanks to the founding of the Juche idea the popular masses could play a role as masters of their destiny.
					
					 C.P. Mainali, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), said thanks to the Juche idea the victory of the human cause of independence is sure to be accomplished.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Romania, said the Korean people could foil the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK as they took the Juche idea as a guiding idea.
					
					 All the successes made by them in building a thriving nation are the fruition of the embodiment of the Juche idea, he added.
					
					 Baguma Isoke, director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said the immortal Juche idea is a great revolutionary theory that indicates the way for the world progressives to confidently advance towards future.
					
					 Harish Gupta, director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, said the Juche idea is giving great power and encouragement to the progressive mankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was carried by the Bangladeshi paper Natun Katha on May 16 and the gist of the work by the Nepali paper Arpan on May 18.
					 The work, published on April 27, 2012, clarifies the undying exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the country's land as befitting that of a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by British Public Figures
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by British Public Figures
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in London on May 12 to hear the report of the delegation of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on its visit to the DPRK to participate in the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Chairman Dermot Hudson of the Association in his report on the delegation's visit to the DPRK said:
					
					 It was my seventh visit to the DPRK.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to witness for myself the changed appearance of the DPRK whenever I visited it.
					
					 The successes made by the DPRK in all fields including politics, economy, military and social life are the brilliant fruition of the Songun revolutionary leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people elected the dear respected Kim Jong Un first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 This was a proof of the Korean people's boundless trust and support for him.
					
					 The chairman explained in detail the facts that Kim Jong Un is successfully carrying forward Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary cause and the World Congress on the Juche Idea and the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of the President were held with splendor.
					
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, underscored the need to more deeply study and disseminate Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism after reading out the Pyongyang Declaration adopted at the World Congress on the Juche Idea.
					
					 A professor of the London University who is a member of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said the President made an undying contribution to the human history by hewing out the path which no leaders of any other country have ever traversed. The Juche idea founded by him clearly indicates the road to be followed by the world revolution, he added.

articles.title: Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Reported by Chinese TV
articles.content:
Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Reported by Chinese TV
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Phoenix Satellite TV Holdings LTD., Hong Kong, China on May 16 reported that the dear respected Kim Jong Un formulated Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the guiding idea of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 It said:
					
					 In his work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" on April 6, 2012 Kim Jong Un formulated Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the guiding idea of the WPK.
					
					 He also proclaimed the modeling of the whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the supreme programme of the WPK.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as Kimilsungism and advanced a programme for modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism.
					
					 The Korean people have long called the revolutionary ideas of the President and Kim Jong Il as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and recognized it as the guiding idea of the WPK.
					
					 But Kim Jong Il persistently objected to linking Kimilsungism, the guiding idea of the WPK, with his august name.
					
					 Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is an integral system of the idea, theory and method of Juche and a great revolutionary idea representing the Juche era.
					
					 The WPK could lead the revolution and construction to victory without making even a single error in implementing its line, thanks to Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the great guiding idea.
					
					 "The Rules of the Workers' Party of Korea" revised at the Fourth WPK Conference stipulate that great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the only guiding idea of the party.

articles.title: China Objects to US Senate Decision against Iran
articles.content:
China Objects to US Senate Decision against Iran
 Beijing, May 26 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesman Hong Lei in a press conference held on Wednesday voiced opposition to the U.S. Senate's recent decision against Iran as well as those countries cooperating with it in the field of economy and trade, describing U.S. action as unilateral and one-sided. 
					 Washington is not entitled to force any country to implement the decision made inside USA, concluded the spokesman.

articles.title: Russia Raps Statement of NATO Summit
articles.content:
Russia Raps Statement of NATO Summit
 Moscow, May 26 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Russian Foreign Ministry Thursday chided the statement made at NATO summit.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Russia could not repress its disappointment as the statement of NATO summit asked Russia not to recognize the independence of Abkhazia and Southern Osetiya.
					
					 NATO did not take measures for preventing the tragic event in August of 2008 and deliberately disregarded information about political events in Georgia in its recent statement.
					
					 Abkhazia and Southern Osetiya are independent sovereign states no matter what other may say.
